channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Legal grounds for 'blanket ban' on managed isolation exemptions questioned
item.description: A legal academic says the Ministry of Health appears unsure if a "blanket ban" on compassionate exemptions from managed isolation is legal.

item.title: Eco-sanctuaries, zoos, rescue hospitals get $15m boost
item.description: Wildlife sanctuaries and zoos suffering from lost revenue due to the Covid-19 lockdown are being propped up with nearly $15 million in government funding.

item.title: Man who fled Hamilton isolation hotel 'the nicest guy ever'
item.description: A Queenstown woman says she warned the man who fled a Hamilton isolation hotel to visit a liquor store not to do it.

item.title: Southland mayors hopeful Tiwai Point aluminium smelter can stay open
item.description: The mayors have vowed to fight for more than 2500 jobs under threat when Tiwai Point aluminium smelter closes in August.

item.title: Fire at house in Lower Hutt
item.description: Three fire crews are working to put out a garage fire in the Lower Hutt suburb of Taita.

item.title: Bleach sellers arrested over Covid claims
item.description: Four Florida men have been charged for selling a bleach - also sold in NZ - as a Covid-19 cure. Susan Strongman reports.

item.title: Rio Tinto's smelter closure unnerves Mataura locals on waste removal
item.description: The closure of Tiwai Point aluminium smelter has raised concerns over what it will mean for the thousands of tonnes of potentially toxic waste stored in the town of Mataura.

item.title: Man charged over leaving Hamilton isolation facility named
item.description: A Queenstown man, charged over absconding from a Hamilton hotel on Thursday night while in Covid-19 managed isolation, has been remanded into the custody of the Department of Corrections.

item.title: Councillor challenges Taranaki horse racing club's 'sweetheart' lease deal
item.description: A name change more than 20 years ago is putting the 120-year history of horse racing in New Plymouth in doubt.

item.title: Mosque attack victim's brother offers emergency workers free meals
item.description: The brother of a Christchurch mosque attack victim is offering free food for emergency service workers at his new restaurant to say thank you.

item.title: Compassionate leave ban stops New Zealander from seeing dying father in final hours
item.description: A judge has questioned the legality of the government's ban on managed isolation exemptions after a man was denied the chance to farewell his dying father.

item.title: Warbirds over Wanaka crash: Communication errors revealed in court
item.description: Communication errors have been exposed in the High Court case into events leading up to an expensive crash at Warbirds over Wanaka.

item.title: Covid-19 isolation escapes: 'These are not prisons, these are hotels' - Health Minister
item.description: The Health Minister says there are two new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, and has defended the managed isolation system, saying the third escape this week did not represent a failure of the system.

item.title: Police arrest 29 people in major drug bust in Waikato
item.description: Police have arrested 29 people, including a senior Mongrel Mob member, after a three-month operation on drug dealing in the Waikato region.

item.title: Dunedin students in sustainable living experiment
item.description: Dunedin students are being offered the opportunity to ditch takeaways and two-minute noodles in favour of growing vegetables and composting waste.

item.title: Rare shore plover chick survives nine months on mainland
item.description: One of the world's rarest shorebirds, a shore plover chick has been successfully bred at a Hawke's Bay sanctuary for the first time.

item.title: Man arrested after cutting through fence to escape Hamilton isolation facility
item.description: A who has twice tested negative for Covid-19 is believed to have cut through a 1.8m fence at a Hamilton isolation hotel to go to a liquor store.

item.title: Sanford crew guilty of violent attack in Falkland Islands pub
item.description: Three New Zealanders have pleaded guilty to violent disorder charges after attacking patrons at a pub on the Falkland Islands.
